Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree

Class LinkedBinaryTree<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.AbstractTree<E>
      • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.AbstractBinaryTree<E>
        • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.LinkedBinaryTree<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements stored in the binary tree
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BinaryTree<E>, Tree<E>
    public class LinkedBinaryTree<E>
extends AbstractBinaryTree<E>
    The LinkedBinaryTree is implemented as a linked data structure to support efficient Binary Tree abstract data type behaviors. Size is maintained as a global field to ensure O(1) worst-case runtime of size() and isEmpty(). The LinkedBinaryTree class is based on the implementation developed for use with the textbook: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java, Sixth Edition Michael T. Goodrich, Roberto Tamassia, and Michael H. Goldwasser John Wiley and Sons, 2014
    Author:
    Dr. King, Tung Tran

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      A BinaryTreeNode stores an element and references the node's parent, left child, and right child

      Returns a reference to the new root position of the tree that is created to store the given element

      • addLeft

        public Position<E> addLeft​(Position<E> p,
                           E value)
        The code for this method is based on the addLeft algorithm on page 328 in the course textbook "Data Structures and Algorithms" by Goodrich, Tamassia, Goldwasser.
        Parameters:
        p - the position for which to add a new left child
        value - the element to add to the tree in the newly created position
        Returns:
        the position that is created as the left child of the provided position
